newsitem.title: ITALY: Lira must stay in ERM despite weakness - employers.
newsitem.headline: Lira must stay in ERM despite weakness - employers.

text.p: The lira's recent weakness shows that exchange rate problems are surfacing but the currency must remain with Europe's exchange rate grid, Giorgio Fossa, chairman of Italian employers' body Confindustria, said.

"Confindustria has said many times that the effective value of our currency in the ERM should have been around 1.000 to 1,050 per mark," he told reporters attending a business meeting. The lira returned to the grid last November.
"But given that the central parity is 990 per mark we can't possibly allow the lira to leave the grid," he said.

Fossa said that a lira above 1,000 per mark could help exports but attention must be paid to the dangers of imported inflation. "We must not forget that we import raw materials in dollars and semi-finished goods in marks."
He said Italy must prove to its European partners and the international markets its will not only to achieve the Maastricht parameters but above all to keep to them.
